<@U3U23MGQ0> use a database. Also, I can’t understand why you’re holding JSONArray and JSONObject.
<@U2M0WUZ7A>  this list generated from API and API has pagination.I need to save all data from API into DB finally all data save in DB only
I want to sure about all data MUST sync into DB or this sync descart if any failure  occurs

1. Check twice, check three times, check a gazillion times if you *really* need to save *all this data*. If yes…
2. Use more compact format to save broadband. E. g. protobuf.
3. Add your data to database in a transaction instead of holding it in memory. After last page inserted, set your transaction successful (commit it).
yes I use transaction for saving data in to DB
but problem is that
Total data is 1000 and every pagination has 100 raw i must sure save 1000 raw into db using transaction or cancel all sync
Then you need to save them in chunks and later verify the completeness
Cause there is no way to make “too much data” more efficient apart from splitting it up
yep, also I’d ask “why” you have to do it. Looks like you’re making something like instagram and neither instagram keeps 1000 items cached at a time
discuss it with your PM since this is a product problem, not a software problem
Yes its from Instagram API
and all data must be sync with time to time
why?
bcz i have to manipulate new  data with old data
why do you need 1000 items?
i have uploaded 1000 media
so all media data save to local DB
and delta will show
why _1000_ tho?
is it your own app? or are you working for a client or your company?
Should invent another way to do this.
its X number

in that case, you’ll need instagram's whole infrastructure and more.

You should go to /r/MachineLearning or /r/MLQuestions

i am more curious how you will get the data :stuck_out_tongue:
Not sure, by using Go Kart car and hit dummy model (like on shops)
You should maybe start with a more reasonable project, to dive into ML
Dude things like this take time
You are learning a new field
Project is not specific, i can start with hello world :slightly_smiling_face: But can i come to the point to do sth like above, say in 4 months?
it depends on how much time you can spend into it I think
2-3 hours :stuck_out_tongue:

Also, since this is the development channel, to make the app you could look into tensorflow for Android, but it would kill the battery quickly since you would need to run the trained model regularly (to detect a collision by a car)
Or you could send aggregated data to a server in order to process it (it would be less painful for the phone)

Hi everyone, my app is crashing on KitKat giving XML Inflate Exception `Caused by: android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: File res/drawable/ic_call_black_24dp.xml from drawable resource ID #0x7f0200a9` . 
I am extending AppCompatActivity for all my Activities, 
In my `build.gradle (app)` , I have set `vectorDrawables.useSupportLibrary = true` , 
I even tried setting `android:src=image` to `app:srcCompat=image`  and `static { AppCompatDelegate.setCompatVectorFromResourcesEnabled(true); }` at the top of each Activity, but to no avail
So I can't figure out why using the inbuilt vector-drawable (the `ic_call_black_24dp.xml` in this case ) not automatically being converted into a png for use in Android version below 21
you probably have the drawable in `drawable-v21` instead of in `drawable`
<@U39P7U6EP> Thanks for replying. yes I have a few drawables in v-21, but when move them to drawables instead, I get a build error of duplicate resources

But why doesn't `static { AppCompatDelegate.setCompatVectorFromResourcesEnabled(true); }` work, I think it should handle all of that on its own, without me having to use `app:srcCompat` instead of  `android:src`

Hi guys, strangely, this worked :
1. Removing `static { AppCompatDelegate.setCompatVectorFromResourcesEnabled(true); }`
2. Removing `vectorDrawables.useSupportLibrary = true` from *build.gradle*
3. Not using `srcCompat`
